Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <torsten1> This is not the first and not the last time something similar happens. Keyloggers, clipboard sniffers, etc. Theoretically any wallet, especially Nodejs wallet with external dependencies can be exploited exactly the same manner. We could and should have done a better job with auditing external packages, and we take responsibility 100%. This is not about “OMG Komodo can access anyone’s funds wtf”. That is not the case and has never been the case. (re @xarux: quite rightly said!)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> I think that the immediate and proactive action from the team shows their competence. (re @mozsi: Your real concern should be dev competence)

Content:
use Agama from here: https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.6.0.13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview
and disable proxy setting: https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000029569-how-to-stop-agama-from-using-a-proxy-server-to-access-electrum-servers/

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
For Lite mode users:
https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.6.0.13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview download that
it is safe
first create a new wallet (new seed)
note down the address
then import the old seed, send all funds to the new address
if "electrum error" or "get_balance error", follow this guide: https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000029569-how-to-stop-agama-from-using-a-proxy-server-to-access-electrum-servers/
